title: Chafetz Chaim on Sifra
enDesc: Best known for his legal and ethical writings, Rabbi Yisrael Meir Kagan (Chafetz Chaim) also wrote a commentary on Sifra, a legal midrash on Leviticus. His introduction emphasizes Torah study, especially of Leviticus, whose laws of sacrifices and ritual purity he sees as crucial but often neglected. The author describes finding a rare copy of the Vilna Gaon’s commentary on Sifra and realizing it was as inaccessible as others. He therefore wrote his own commentary, based on predecessors but in brief, clear language, and published it together with explanations of the Vilna Gaon’s commentary.
enShortDesc: 18th-century commentary on the core halakhic (legal) midrash on the Book of Leviticus.
